name: Paradise Village Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.text: This is the 7th or 8th time we have stayed here. We very much enjoy coming back year after year. The rooms are very nice. Clean and well kept, with maid service everyday. They have plenty of room and good size kitchens. We stayed in a two bedroom. Some two bedrooms have a king bed in each and others have a king bed in one room and two twins in the other. The one or two bedrooms have a pull out couch in the main room. The beds are quite comfortable but the pull out couch is not. Good enough for kids, but an adult would not be too happy on one. There are two main pools. One is relaxed and more for adults. The other one has two large water slides and organized activities going on most of the day i.e,, bingo, pool volleyball. My 8 and 11 yr old very much enjoy the goings-on of the activity pool. The beach is right there and the waves are just big enough to do a little boogie boarding, but the current is never very strong so the weak swimmer can feel safe. I really like the friendly service. The staff always seems more than happy to help. Room service food is very good. The pool side food is very good and at a good price. The restaurant "Mayapan" has been disappointing, the Tulum restaurant is better. Monday nights they have a Mexican Fiesta which has a floor show with Mexican music and dance. it is fun night if your a first-timer.
reviews.title: Great for Families

likes.disliked: — pull out couch, time share presentation offers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last two times we went we have been going out to restaurants in the area. One restaurant is called Meson Bay in Bucerias, a 15 minute cab ride. Its an outdoor place right on the Beach, great margaritas and good fish, inexpensive.
reviews.title: Puerto Vallarta not ready for tourists

reviews.text: Finally, Paradise Village is also a time-share property. So there is an attempt to get you to go to a presentation. They will give you incentives by offering discounts, etc. If you decide to go for the presentation let me give you a tip. The first day they will offer you some discounts, by the third or fourth day, you can get them to offer much more i.e,, $100 toward dinner, two massages, free activities, etc. So if your tempted to go, you can get more than they originally offer.
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation!
Loved the Villa
reviews.text: I don’t want to ramble too much so I will try and itemize this as fast as I can (At work lol).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Male, 25 years old from NYC/CT, travel a lot.
reviews.title: Paradise in Mexico

likes.liked: — well maintained, great facilities and staff

reviews.title: Good stay
reviews.text: All prior reviews regarding the timeshare issue are pretty accurate. The key is how to avoid the issue if that is what you want to do. The wristbands are a signal to the "pink shirts" that are aggressive (they chased us our the front door one day) if they think they can get you to a session. We followed the advice of a prior post and cut them off after the second day. The key is to put them in the safe as you have to turn them in when you leave. You may lose the "discount" (5%) if you do not have them on, but the hotel did honor the discount anyway. You do have to look out for the guys at the tiki hut at the entrance as they will try and get you to go to the timeshare sell as well. Overall the hotel is nice. They did put us in a room that was below what we had reserved (we had a king suit, they put us in a tower with two doubles), only to move us back to the main complex and a king suite. The only problem was they gave the same room to someone later and they walked in as we were getting ready to go out. No foul, and felt bad for them. The room was a little musty and faced the front of the resort, but that was ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is nice, and we brought our own food and drink which cuts down on costs. We did go to Walmart which was worth it in my opinion. The tours through Vallarta Adventures were great and I highly recommend booking tours with them. We did rhytms of the night and Yalapa which were great. We also did the ATVs with Wild vallatra. They are a little low end in appearance, but do a great job. We heard good things about the canopy tours as well.
reviews.title: I've been to better places....

reviews.text: The Cheeky Monkey in PV is fun (as recommend by others) the Corona bottles and Margaritas are only $1 and the view was great.
reviews.title: Happy Returning Customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, reading all the posts helped and the key is to enjoy and avoid what you want and try what you want.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traded into Paradise Village from our home timeshare in Cabo. We were really excited to see someplace new and different. We were surprised. The rooms aren't that great. If you trade in from another resort, you won't be able to get a beach or pool view, only the marina. You will also have to walk a bit to the pools. Also the beds are very uncomfortable. Think concrete. The Coba Tower where we stayed did have washer/dryer, but the other rooms on the resort do not.
reviews.title: Paradise Village is "okay".

likes.liked: — The adult pool and the beach
likes.disliked: — The smeel of furniture polish; apparently what they used to clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 weeks at Paradise Village Beach Resort and Spa in Nuevo Vallarta (Puerto Vallarta), Mexico........ it was fantastic. The beach is very clean, the service wonderful, rooms very clean - just a wonderful place to vacation.
reviews.title: Truly enjoyed our stay at Paradise Village Beach and Resort

likes.liked: — That the grounds are very well kept and large - the many palapas

reviews.text: We truly enjoyed having the full kitchen in our room and the convience of having a grocery store in the Paradise Village Mall and when we ended up with too many groceries - one of the boys that worked at the grocery store would carry the groceries for you or you could take the little cart that came around every 15 minutes. If you are not into fixing your own meals...... there are several restaurants and palapa snack bars to order from.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort!

likes.liked: — Everything you could want is nearby and the beach is the best.
likes.disliked: — In some rooms the palm trees block your view.

reviews.text: Very nice - thank you Paradise Village!
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Paradise Village for four years straight and are NEVER disappointed. The staff make you feel as if you are coming home and will do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. I really enjoy all of the activities, but many times just love to walk on the beach and watch the sunset. We think this is the best beach in Puerto Vallarta.
reviews.title: Great resort, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is easy to take the bus into downtown for some shopping - though the prices at the mall next to Paradise Village are competitive with those downtown. They also have a grocery store right there so you can stock up.
reviews.title: Every Day is like Paradise

likes.liked: — everything/the weather is perfect the times we have gone (end of april first of may)

reviews.text: We used my parents points to stay in a two bedroom suite at Paradise Villiage. With three kids 6, 7, 8 this was perfect. We have stayed at All-inclusive resorts with them before and really enjoyed being able to cook our own food. A quick trip to walmart and we had enough food for 10 days. The kids ate much healthier and they enjoyed the food.
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Resort

likes.liked: — The fact it was a full suite with two bathrooms and two bedrooms and full kitchen.

reviews.text: This resort is perfect for kids. The two waterslides in the main pool were a blast. They had daily activities like paper airplane and belly flop competitions for the kids at the main pool. There was a pinata every Saturday and they enjoyed this as well.
reviews.title: we nick named it retirement village............

reviews.text: We had a corner two bedroom unit so we had a marina and an ocean view.
reviews.title: A get away to Paradise

likes.liked: — Comfortable, One Bedroom has two bathrooms, internet acces
likes.disliked: — More american chanels on the T.V.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kids club was very expensive so they didn't spend alot of time there but did enjoy making crafts the one day they went.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort and spa

reviews.text: Boogie boarding was fabulous as the ocean at Paradise Village is fairly shallow and the kids could go pretty far and still be waist deep. We never had a problem getting a seat at the beach or the pool.
reviews.title: Thought It Was Great

likes.liked: — The location was amazing and the kitchens were extremely convenient

description: Discover your Paradise! Elegantly situated in the heart of Nuevo Vallarta, Riviera Nayarit, located within its own peninsula all set against a spectacular tropical backdrop, Paradise Village Resort and Spa is an all inclusive and European plan all-suite designer accommodations beachfront hotel, is a five star development that offers a gorgeous beach! Just 15 minutes away from Puerto Vallarta International Airport.
